intro: Macropanax undulatus, commonly known as the wavy-leaf macropanax, is a species of flowering plant in the Araliaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its large, undulating leaves that can reach up to 1 meter in length. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, followed by bright red berries. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
